SEARCH
Package cop4331.gui

Class ShoppingSystem

java.lang.Object
cop4331.gui.ShoppingSystem
public class ShoppingSystem extends Object
The ShoppingSystem class manages the main functionality of the shopping application. It handles user interactions, data storage, and screen transitions.
Author:
S Hassan Shaikh, Austin Vasquez, Divyesh Mangapuram, Jorge Martinez

  • Method Details

    • StartApp

      public void StartApp()
      Starts the shopping application by setting up the main view, loading data from files, and displaying the login screen.

    • OpenLoginScreen

      public void OpenLoginScreen()
      Opens the login screen where users can log in to their accounts.

    • OpenRegisterScreen

      public void OpenRegisterScreen()
      Opens the registration screen where new users can create accounts.

    • OpenSettingsScreen

      public void OpenSettingsScreen()
      Opens the settings screen where users can manage their account settings.

    • OpenShoppingScreen

      public void OpenShoppingScreen(Customer currentCustomer)
      Opens the shopping screen for a specific customer, displaying available items for purchase. This method sets up the GUI to show available items for the customer to browse and buy. It populates the screen with a list of items from sellers and enables the user to interact with each item to potentially add them to the shopping cart.
      Parameters:
      currentCustomer - The customer currently logged into the shopping system.

    • AddItemToCartScreen

      public void AddItemToCartScreen(Customer currentCustomer, Item item)
      Displays a screen for adding an item to the customer's cart. This method shows a GUI screen where the user can view details of a specific item and add it to their shopping cart with a specified quantity.
      Parameters:
      currentCustomer - The customer currently logged into the shopping system.
      item - The item the user intends to add to their shopping cart.

    • OpenShoppingCartScreen

      public void OpenShoppingCartScreen(Customer currentCustomer)
      Opens the shopping cart screen for a specific customer. This method constructs a graphical user interface displaying the items currently added to the customer's shopping cart. It allows users to view the cart contents, modify the quantities of items, remove items, and proceed to complete the purchase transaction if all items are available and valid.
      Parameters:
      currentCustomer - The customer whose shopping cart is being displayed.

    • OpenReceiptView

      public void OpenReceiptView(Customer currentCustomer, ArrayList<String[]> receipt, float cartTotal)
      Opens a receipt view displaying the details of a completed transaction. Constructs a graphical user interface to show the transaction receipt, listing the purchased items, their prices, and quantities. Also includes a "Done" button to return to the shopping screen.
      Parameters:
      currentCustomer - The customer who completed the transaction.
      receipt - An ArrayList containing String arrays with item details for the receipt.
      cartTotal - The total cost of the items in the cart.

    • OpenInventoryScreen

      public void OpenInventoryScreen(Seller currentSeller)
      Opens the inventory screen for a specific seller. Constructs a graphical user interface to display the seller's inventory, allowing the seller to view their listed items, their availability, prices, stock, and remove items from sale. It also provides an option to add new items.
      Parameters:
      currentSeller - The seller whose inventory is being displayed.

    • OpenItemEditScreen

      public void OpenItemEditScreen(Seller currentSeller, int itemIndex)
      Opens the screen for editing an item's details. If editing an existing item, it retrieves the item's details and sets up the screen. If adding a new item, initializes an empty item for editing.
      Parameters:
      currentSeller - The seller whose item is being edited or for whom a new item is being added.
      itemIndex - The index of the item being edited in the seller's inventory. Use -1 to initialize a new item for addition.

    • GetSellerFromUsername

      public Seller GetSellerFromUsername(String username) throws NoSuchElementException
      Retrieves a seller object based on the provided username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the seller to search for.
      Returns:
      The Seller object associated with the provided username.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no seller is found with the given username.

    • GetCustomerFromUsername

      public Customer GetCustomerFromUsername(String username) throws NoSuchElementException
      Retrieves a customer object based on the provided username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the customer to search for.
      Returns:
      The Customer object associated with the provided username.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no customer is found with the given username.

    • UsernameTaken

      public boolean UsernameTaken(String testUsername)
      Checks if a username is taken by either a seller or a customer.
      Parameters:
      testUsername - The username to be checked for availability.
      Returns:
      True if the username is taken by either a seller or a customer, otherwise false.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] Args)
      Main entry point of the application. Initiates the starting of the system.
      Parameters:
      Args - The command line arguments provided to the program.

    • GetInstance

      public static ShoppingSystem GetInstance()
      Retrieves the instance of the ShoppingSystem (singleton pattern).
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of the ShoppingSystem.
